sub_title: I use the power of music and play to motivate communities to develop and individuals to learn & grow
summary:
I am an experienced Musician / Music educator / Facilitator / Trainer / Online Education and Learning Consultant. I do my best at addressing some of the world's challenges through music performing, education and advisory for entrepreneurs and organizations in the fields of the arts, education, culture and social impact when it comes to project conception and development. 

I focus on and support social strengthening of at-risk communities and children with refugee status. The experience I gained from working, studying and researching in Colombia, Norway, Germany, and now The Netherlands, have made me focus on creating a positive impact on people's life's through the communication and team dynamics found in music.

With trainings for music educators and music workshops for young people but also adults and professional teams, I explore concepts like intercultural and cross-cultural communication, diversity, inclusion, peace and solidarity, belonging, resilience, democracy and community building.

It's always hard to explain with words what I do, so just look at the videos down here 👇

Check out my website
www.juandavidgarzon.com

treasury_media.title: On The Spot: A Space for Community Collective Music Creation
treasury_media.description: Together with Kirsten Gerritsen, Anan AL-Kadamani and Pim van der Mijl we are developing a space to share experiences and talents through music. Diffusing the line that divides musicians from audience, trained musicians and non-musicians concert hall and community space and many other opposites. We want to turn around how the traditional jam session works and create an environment where the multiculturally richness of the city of Utrecht blends with its people!

treasury_media.title: Building Belonging Through the Recognition of the Other @ The Hague University of Applied Sciences
treasury_media.description:
"Building Belonging Through the Recognition of the Other" was the name I gave to the workshop I was invited to give to the 1st year students of social work of The Hague University of Applied Sciences. 

​The workshop had as a goal, to show the students how integrating music in their practice can create a big impact on communities and on the social worker.

projects.title: The Intuitive Orchestra - Community / Team Building Through Music Improvisation
projects.description: This is a workshop aimed to develop and strengthen communities, groups or teams communication and understanding of the self, the other and the community through sound and play. The workshop addresses and plays with the concept of democracy and living in society. It is offered to communities with members of different backgrounds and origins as well as organizations and businesses that want to develop a better communication in their teams.

projects.title: Workshop Given - Music Lab "Community Building Through Music" - Lübeck, Germany
projects.description: An intensive one week music workshop for youngsters. Different improvisation and music writing exercises are used to address subjects like equality, democracy, inclusion, self recognition, the acknowledgement of the other and community building through creative work.

projects.title: (Workshop Given) Conception, Development and Management of Artistic, Pedagogic, Social and Cultural Projects. Bogotá - Colombia
projects.description: 1 Day workshop aimed at creative professionals that included the medical & health sector, artists and music creators, and social impact projects through music. Together we went through the different stages of conceiving, planning, managing and closing a project in the different areas, and we did a special focus on pitch, and funding simulations.

profile_positions.description: Honoured to make part of the amazing trainers team of MWB that works all around the world creating connection and bringing the power of music to communities and individuals affected by the harshness of armed conflict.
profile_positions.title: Trainer

profile_positions.description:
Teaching the Online Music Methodologies module at the: Methodologies & Technologies of Music Training Program aimed at music educators. 

I focus on: 
Online Research 
Teaching & Learning Platforms, 
Online teaching strategies. 
Online safety
Collaborative online learning
And more.
profile_positions.title: Guest Teacher

profile_positions.description:
For 10 years I have been advising education institutions, non-profit organizations, facilitators and therapists in the fields of the arts, pedagogics and social work to better understand how the internet can be a very powerful tool of research, connection and motivation. I have presented, given workshops and supported organizations in central and south America as well as in Europe. During the Covid-19 crisis I have focused my work with institutions and individuals on how to transition to a remote work using the internet as a way of creating connection and staying strong as a community. 

I currently lecture on the subject at the Javeriana University of Bogotá and the Universidad del Norte of Barranquilla

Some of my clients are: 
- The Latin-America Forum of Musical Education 
- The University of Agder
- Musicians Without Borders
- Javeriana University, Music Department Teacher Staff
- Tontalente e.V. 
- Next Generation Stage School
- Filarmonica Joven de Colombia
- All Stars Project London
- Gimnasio Campestre
profile_positions.title: Online Learning & Teaching Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As a socially engaged artist, I have devoted myself to facilitate social change through the arts, sound and play. I want to help others to connect with their own self, the others and their communities using the power of music and the arts, through their communicative and team dynamics. I have experience working with communities that undergo significant stress because of refuge seeking, cultural clash, extreme poverty and social injustice.

Some of the organizations I work with: 
* Tontalente e.V. - Germany
* Play Perform Learn Grow - Greece
* De Voorkamer - The Netherlands

At the same time I use these same methods to help teams and organizations to strengthen bonds and deepen in their communication and work capacities through workshops and mid term trainings using music, sound and play.
profile_positions.title: Community / Team Development Facilitator & Trainer Through Sound and Play

profile_positions.description:
I help other professionals and artists to focus and follow through with social, entrepreneurship projects and startups. From the very conception, through the project management and later project closure, I have provided clues and direction for independent artists, music businesses, social impact and education organizations. I also help people and organizations to connect and establish trustworthy and long-lasting professional relationships. 

Some organizations that I advise:

* The Young Philharmonic Orchestra of Colombia 
* La Horrorosa - Music / Dance Event Curation. Spain
* Pop Funk Musik - Management Agency - Norway
* Asociacion Faisca Voadora - Intercultural Youth Exchanges - Portugal
* Pianomovil - Education organization - Colombia
profile_positions.title: Arts, Education, Social Impact, Creative Industries Project Conception & Development Consultant

profile_positions.description:
New Media Technologies Applied to Music Teaching / Creative Projects Development @ the Musical Training Methodologies Diploma Program

• Developed and taught the course content aimed at music teachers and educators already working in the field.
•  Key focus: Webquests & online research methodologies for the classroom, online communication and project building outside of the classroom.
profile_positions.title: Professor

profile_positions.description:
• Mentored and instructed music teachers in training enrolled in the Music Pedagogy training program. 
• Developed from the ground up the popular music curriculum of the university’s Youth Music Program acting as Popular Area Coordinator
• Developed and supervised the students online music magazine/blog for the Youth Music Program.
• Involved in music promotion, event management, student and teacher affairs and admissions.
• Taught: Electric Bass, Solfege, Ear Training, Popular Music Ensembles, Popular Music at the bachelor of music and the Youth program
profile_positions.title: Fully enrolled teacher and area coordinator

profile_positions.description: Working as an external professional providing intensive artistic workshops and trainings for children and youth and advising the organization with the formulation and development of projects aimed to inclusion, diversity, community building, peace building and democracy through music.
profile_positions.title: External Trainer, Workshop Leader

profile_positions.description:
• Mentored and instructed music teachers in training at the different primary and middle school programs
• Provided personal guidance to integrate and include refugee children into the German society through music.
• Developed the children music program and curriculum.
• Expanded the reach of the Kids District Orchestra Eichholz as musical Conductor / Director,
• Established communication channels with schools, teachers, social workers, parents and cooperation partners.
• Built and strengthened an event department.

As a music educator I led groups at 3 different schools where many refugee children start their first classes in the German school system. There we worked with inclusion and integration into their new environment through music projects that puts them together with children raised in Germany. Through songs, both from the German Pop repertoire and self composed, the children got a new approach towards this new language. Having to communicate with each other to solve different musical situations like when they are learning their instrument parts in smaller groups, have proved to give these students a set of skills that they would not achieve so fast by other means. From projects like the Lebenskünstler, a couple of students have discovered their passion for music and have decided to seek a semi-professional career.

I provided training in music pedagogics and counselling for the teachers of the different projects and established communication paths between students-teachers-schools-parents and cooperation partners. 

I conducted, directed and wrote for The Children District Orchestra Eichholz in Lübeck which is an integration project with the goal to provide a space where kids can interact in a productive way, towards a common objective, despite their differences in social, cultural and language background. 

There, I also did the event management for Tontalente. This involved the planning, conduction and assessment of the organization’s events.
profile_positions.title: Youth Programs Director / Music Educator / Project Development / Event Management

profile_positions.description: Conductor for Children Rock-Pop Choir "Rock Pop Kids" for ages 6-14
profile_positions.title: Choir Director

profile_positions.description: Teacher for E-Bass, Guitar, Keyboard, Singing Coaching
profile_positions.title: Music Teacher

volunteer_experiences.role: International Organizer / Part of Fundraising, Outreach and Media Team

company.name: Play Perform Learn Grow - International Conference

volunteer_experiences.description:
I make part of the international organizers committee in the Outreach, Fundraising and Media Teams.

PPLG.org: Play, Perform, Learn, Grow (PPLG) 2019 is co-organized by East Side Institute, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Lesvos Solidarity and Epineio Institute. PPLG will bring together educators and researchers, therapists, social scientists, artists, psychologists and movement practitioners, social and youth workers, performance activists and community organizers – refugees, migrants and locals, and all others who are seeking new, and often performatory, ways to address the pain, alienation, and violence of our times. PPLG will also focus on the exploration of methodologies that support educational, therapeutic, academic, artistic and community initiatives to discover dialectics in between polarities, capture complexities, articulate and perform new kinds of relationships.
Helping Amsterdam and Utrecht Business Breakfast with on-site event organization, promotion on social media, newsletter content creation, event-platforms management.

I'm currently helping with music support, giving music workshops and co-hosting for some of De Voorkamer's musical events. The organization is a meeting spot for newcomers and locals of all backgrounds, nationalities and cultures through the exchange of talents and culture.
Responsible of online promotion to non-norwegian speakers. Written concert reviews for the webpage. Responsible of production and setting of venues and concerts.
